file.content:
# AINCROK - AI Code Assistant for VS Code
> AINCROK Is Not Cline Roo Or Kilo
[![Version](https://img.shields.io/visual-studio-marketplace/v/aincrok.aincrok)](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=aincrok.aincrok) [![Downloads](https://img.shields.io/visual-studio-marketplace/d/aincrok.aincrok)](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=aincrok.aincrok) [![License](https://img.shields.io/github/license/aincrok/aincrok)](LICENSE) [![GitHub Stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/aincrok/aincrok)](https://github.com/aincrok/aincrok)
## üöÄ Overview
AINCROK is a powerful AI-powered code assistant for Visual Studio Code, forked from Kilocode with significant enhancements. It provides intelligent code completion, multi-file editing, and seamless integration with various LLM providers.
## ‚ú® Features
- ü§ñ **Multi-Provider Support**: OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and more - üìù **Autonomous Multi-File Editing**: Edit multiple files simultaneously - üí¨ **Persistent Conversation History**: Never lose your coding context - üé® **Intuitive WebView Interface**: Modern, responsive UI within VS Code - üöÄ **Template System**: Customizable prompts and workflows - üíª **Terminal Integration**: Execute commands directly from conversations - üîß **Highly Configurable**: Adapt to your workflow
## üì¶ Installation
### From VS Code Marketplace 1. Open VS Code 2. Press `Ctrl+P` / `Cmd+P` 3. Type `ext install aincrok.aincrok`
### From Source ```bash git clone https://github.com/aincrok/aincrok.git cd aincrok npm install npm run compile ```
## üîß Configuration
See [Configuration Guide](docs/CONFIGURATION.md) for detailed setup instructions.
## üìñ Documentation
- [Getting Started](docs/GETTING_STARTED.md) - [Configuration Guide](docs/CONFIGURATION.md) - [API Reference](docs/API.md) - [Contributing](CONTRIBUTING.md) - [Changelog](CHANGELOG.md)
## ü§ù Contributing
We welcome contributions! Please see our [Contributing Guide](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details.
## üìÑ License
Apache 2.0 - See [LICENSE](LICENSE) for details.
## üôè Acknowledgments
AINCROK is built upon the excellent foundation of: - [AINCROK](https://github.com/Kilo-Org/aincrok) - Original codebase - [Cline](https://github.com/cline/cline) - Inspiration for features - [Roo Coder](https://github.com/roo-coder/roo-coder) - Documentation structure
## üì¨ Support
- [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/aincrok/aincrok/issues) - [Discord Community](https://discord.gg/aincrok) - [Documentation](https://aincrok.dev/docs)

# Contributing to AINCROK
Thank you for your interest in contributing to AINCROK! This document provides guidelines and instructions for contributing.
## Code of Conduct
Please read and follow our [Code of Conduct](CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
## How to Contribute
### Reporting Issues - Check existing issues before creating a new one - Use issue templates when available - Provide clear reproduction steps - Include system information
### Pull Requests 1. Fork the repository 2. Create a feature branch (`feature/amazing-feature`) 3. Commit your changes following conventional commits 4. Write/update tests as needed 5. Update documentation 6. Submit a pull request
### Development Setup ```bash # Clone your fork git clone https://github.com/YOUR-USERNAME/aincrok.git cd aincrok
# Install dependencies npm install
# Run in development mode npm run watch
# Run tests npm test ```
### Coding Standards - TypeScript for all new code - ESLint and Prettier configurations must pass - Maintain test coverage above 80% - Document all public APIs
### Commit Convention We use [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/): - `feat:` New features - `fix:` Bug fixes - `docs:` Documentation changes - `style:` Code style changes - `refactor:` Code refactoring - `test:` Test updates - `chore:` Maintenance tasks
## Development Workflow
1. Pick an issue or create one 2. Fork and create a branch 3. Make your changes 4. Test thoroughly 5. Submit PR with clear description 6. Respond to review feedback
## License
By contributing, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under Apache 2.0.

# Code of Conduct
## Our Pledge
We pledge to make participation in our project a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.
## Our Standards
Examples of behavior that contributes to creating a positive environment: - Using welcoming and inclusive language - Being respectful of differing viewpoints - Gracefully accepting constructive criticism - Focusing on what is best for the community - Showing empathy towards other community members
## Enforcement
Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported to the project team at conduct@aincrok.dev. All complaints will be reviewed and investigated promptly and fairly.
## Attribution
This Code of Conduct is adapted from the [Contributor Covenant](https://www.contributor-covenant.org/), version 2.0.

# Security Policy
## Supported Versions
| Version | Supported | | ------- | ------------------ | | 1.x.x | :white_check_mark: | | < 1.0 | :x: |
## Reporting a Vulnerability
Please report security vulnerabilities to security@aincrok.dev
Do not report security vulnerabilities through public GitHub issues.

# Changelog
All notable changes to AINCROK will be documented in this file.
The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/), and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).
## [1.0.0] - 2025-01-XX
### Added - Initial fork from AINCROK - Complete rebranding to AINCROK - Improved documentation structure - Professional open-source project setup
### Changed - Updated all references from AINCROK to AINCROK - Modernized build configuration - Enhanced TypeScript configurations
### Fixed - Various inherited issues from AINCROK
## Origin
AINCROK is forked from [AINCROK](https://github.com/Kilo-Org/aincrok) with significant enhancements.

package_json_scripts.script: npm run compile && npm run lint

commands.command: git commit -m "feat: initial AINCROK fork from AINCROK with complete rebranding"

License file updated with proper attribution

next_steps.note: After completing this initial setup, the project will be ready for Phase 2: Feature Development and Roadmap Planning

Set up Discord or discussion forum for community
Create project board for tracking development
Plan initial feature enhancements over Kilocode
